title: Waterspout Tears Through Harbour As Spain Flood Death Toll Rises | 10 News
description: A waterspout has been captured on camera ripping through the seafront and hurling debris skywards in the town of Puerto de Mazarrón, off Spain's southeastern coast.  The weather event comes as torrential rains flooded the country’s southern and eastern provinces over the weekend, with one person dead and two missing on Sunday evening.  Spanish Guardia Civil found the body of one missing man on Sunday after his van was swept away by the water, with a male passenger also found dead on Monday. A third man was killed when trying to cross a flooded river on a moped near Granada. title: Anthony Joshua ‘Narrowly Escapes Death’ In Horror Nigeria Crash That Killed Two | 10 News
description: Former world heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua is in hospital with minor injuries after a serious car crash in Nigeria that killed two people.  The crash happened on the Lagos–Ibadan Expressway, with police saying the SUV Joshua was travelling in lost control while overtaking and hit a stationary truck.  Ogun state authorities say two male foreign nationals died at the scene, while Joshua, seated in the rear, narrowly escaped death.  The 35-year-old had been in Nigeria visiting family just days after his win over Jake Paul in Miami. title: Queensland Towns Isolated Amid Monsoonal Rains | 10 News
description: Major highways and roads remain cut off by floodwater across Far North Queensland as intense rainfall enters its third day.  The Bruce Highway, from the Seymour River Bridge at Bemerside, between Ingham and Tully, is closed to all traffic due to the ongoing wet weather.  The Bureau of Meteorology has issued several flood warnings for Townsville to north of Innisfail and parts of inland northwest Queensland, including for life-threatening flash floods.  Watch 10 News at 5pm for the full story. title: Australian Federal Police Allege Gunmen Duo Behind Bondi Beach Terror Attack Acted Alone | 10 News
description: Australian Federal Police have revealed more about the movements of the two alleged gunmen in the weeks leading up to the Bondi terror attack.   The father and son spent almost a month in the Philippines, but authorities are confident they were not involved in any extremist training camps.   AFP Commissioner said, however, that their trip was not a holiday either. title: Bondi Terror Attack Hero Reflects On Brave Actions To Stop Alleged Gunmen | 10 News
description: The Bondi terror attack hero has explained why he couldn’t bring himself to shoot after wrestling a weapon from one of the gunmen.   Ahmed al Ahmed faces a long road to recovery and may have suffered permanent nerve damage after being shot five times, but he says he wouldn’t hesitate to act the same way again. title: Far North Queensland Hit by 700mm of Monsoonal Rain in Two Days | 10 News
description: Far North Queensland towns remain isolated, and farmers are scrambling to save livestock as monsoonal rains enter their third day.   The Bureau of Meteorology says the system is moving slowly, with some communities recording nearly a metre of rain. title: New 55-Day Search for MH370 Underway Off West Australian Coast | 10 News
description: A new search for Malaysian Airlines flight MH370 is underway. A high-tech vessel is scheduled to spend 55 days trawling the seabed thousands of kilometres off the West Australian coast.   The expedition is being conducted under a “no find, no fee” arrangement with the Malaysian government. Loved ones of the missing passengers hope the search will finally provide answers. title: UAE To Withdraw Forces From Yemen After Saudi Arabia Strike On Port | 10 News
description: The United Arab Emirates has said it is pulling out its remaining forces ​in Yemen after Saudi Arabia backed a call for UAE forces to leave the country within 24 hours.  The move came hours after a Saudi-led coalition carried out an air strike ⁠on the southern Yemeni port of Mukalla.  Footage shows the arrival of two ships carrying weapons and combat vehicles to the southern Yemeni port from the UAE port of Fujairah on Saturday and Sunday, which the coalition said was without its authorisation. title: Russia Claims It Has Deployed Nuclear-Capable Oreshnik Missiles To Belarus | 10 News
description: The Russian Defence Ministry has released footage it claims shows Oreshnik intermediate-range ballistic missile systems in Belarus. On December 18, Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko confirmed the arrival of the systems. Russia first tested the Oreshnik in November 2024, with President Vladimir Putin claiming it is impossible to intercept. Putin has warned it could be used against Kyiv’s allies and praised its multiple warheads, which travel at hypersonic speeds. Russian media said the missile could hit an air base in Poland in 11 minutes and NATO headquarters in Brussels in 17. However, there is no way to confirm whether the missile carries a nuclear or conventional warhead before it reaches its target. title: Eurostar Services Disrupted Across Europe After Channel Tunnel Power Failure | 10 News
description: Eurostar services linking London with Paris, Brussels and Amsterdam were suspended for hours after a power supply failure in the Channel Tunnel.  The disruption stranded hundreds of passengers and caused widespread delays and cancellations during peak New Year’s Eve travel.  Eurostar said an overhead power issue and a failed Le Shuttle train were to blame, urging customers to postpone their journeys.  Services are gradually resuming, but travellers are warned disruption is likely to continue. title: One Dead, 30 Injured In Machu Picchu Train Collision | 10 News
description: One person is dead and 30 are injured after two trains bound for Machu Picchu collided on Tuesday, December 30. Police confirmed the deceased was the driver of one of the trains. Among the injured were Peruvian and international tourists, with one reported in serious condition. The collision occurred in a remote mountainous area between the Corihuayrachina and Pampaccahua archaeological sites, approximately 50km from Cusco. Authorities are investigating the cause of the incident. title: Thieves Steal Millions Of Euros After Drilling Into German Bank Vault | 10 News
description: Thieves have stolen tens of millions of euros worth of cash, gold and jewellery after they drilled their way into the underground vault room of the German Sparkasse savings bank from a parking garage.  Authorities said around 2,700 bank customers were affected by the theft in Gelsenkirchen and investigators believe the robbers took off with around $30 million euros (AUD$52 million) worth of property.  Hundreds of distressed bank customers massed outside the branch on Tuesday demanding information as the criminals remain at large.
